rec of the issue.gif

[Affected versions]:
- Firefox Beta 67.0b3, Build ID 20190318154932
- Firefox Nightly 68.0a1, Build ID 20190319215514

[Affected Platforms]:
- All Windows
- All Linux
- All Mac

[Prerequisites]:
- Have the "browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.asrouter.devtoolsEnabled" pref set to "true" in the "about:config" page.

[Steps to reproduce]:
1. Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites.
2. Navigate to the "about:newtab#asrouter" page and scroll down to the "PIN_TAB" section.
3. Click the "Show" button and click the "CFR Recommendation" button from the right part of the "Address Bar".
4. Click the secondary action button from the right part of the "Not Now" one.
5. Select the "Manage Recommendation Settings" option and observe the browser's "Back" button.

[Expected result]:
- The button is inactive.

[Actual result]:
- The "Back" button is active and if it is clicked, the page is scrolled up and back to the "Browsing" section.

[Notes]:
- Attached a screen recording of the issue.
